185997492.review:
This has to be one of the worst AI's I've seen in a long time (!)

Cheating AI to compensate for being bit dumb is common practice in RTS games, but apparently the devs think that their AI is stupid beyond any redemption so they juiced all the cheating levers to the moon and the only thing that remains is artificial difficulty in the most boring and tedious way.

Raiding/attacking an AI is absolutely pointless unless you can actually destroy their main base. They're barely relying on population for their production and any villagers/military units you kill respawn almost instantly anyway so it's absolutely pointless to raid them.

The issue seemed a bit less apparent during the Campaign, so at least that part was bit better balanced. But trying out Conquest mode afterwards is just absolutely disgusting. It's doable, but an absolute drag cause it requires constant micromanagement to barely compensate for all the AI cheating. And even then it takes so long to finish off an opponent because raiding an AI does barely anything, so unless you're way way stronger the AI will just bounce back in the blink of an eye.

Bit of cheating would be fine, but I mean the AI units literally respawn like 2-3+ times faster, and their armies have barely any upkeep so it doesn't matter if you destroy their economy cause they will just field an army of 15+ units without any economy supporting them anyway. It's just a joke imo, this is not an actual challenge.

Please put some actual thought and at least a little bit of effort into your AI so the cheating doesn't have to be so blatantly in your face. 

It's a shame, cause the base game mechanics are interesting enough, the game looks nice visually and has a good theme. The campaign is decent and multiplayer might be fine, but beyond that the AI is a hot broken mess preventing you from having any fun.

185989946.review:
Northgard is like Civilization meets Age of Empires, and the perfect blend for my taste. It is more focused on macro, with an end game population around 50 and your army would be around 10 of those. The average game lasts about an hour. 

Story Mode - This is more of a tutorial for the game. I'm not much of a story person, but the different scenarios are fun to learn more aspects of the game. 

Conquest - This is the mode that most of my playtime is in. It's a series of of 7-11 maps, and for completing each map you get a permanent buff. Three of them are the same every time (per unique clan), and the rest are chosen from a randomized pool. It's perfect for learning all the different clans. There is also a co-op mode for this, and it's a lot of fun with a friend.

Bifrost - This is the newest mode. It is PvE only for up to 4, but playable alone. I've played a few times both alone and with friends. I see this as the next step for me once I complete conquest on every clan. You start with only the basic bonuses of your chosen clan, a very limited number of available buildings, and a simple tech tree. After each winter, you choose a buff, building, or new tech. By the end of a run, you essentially have a completely custom clan and it can lead to a lot of very strong combos.

Overall, amazing game with lots of replayability. Totally recommend giving the base game a try and waiting for any of the DLC to go on sale. In my opinion, all the DLC is worth it, but only if you have interest in playing all the clans.

185968177.review:
•   "Нордгард" сочетает скорость принятия решений и экономическую стратегию.
•   Игра позволяет управлять кланом викингов с уникальными механиками и клановыми знаками.
•   В игре два режима: классическая схватка и завоевание.
•   В схватке можно выбирать условия победы, включая экономику, торговлю, очки славы и захват врат.
•   В завоевании условия победы процедурно генерируются, что делает игру более разнообразной.
•   Основные ресурсы: еда, золото, дерево и камень.
•   Счастье влияет на приток новых рабочих и их эффективность.
•   Еда добывается рабочими на специальных клетках и фермах.
•   Охотники и рыбаки наиболее эффективны, но фермы менее эффективны зимой.
•   Разведка помогает открывать новые регионы и прокачивать здания.
•   Знахари лечат бойцов и крестьян, добывая еду.
•   Дерево используется для всех построек и обогрева домов зимой.
•   Железо и камень важны для улучшения зданий и найма героев.
•   Исследования проводятся за очки преданий, которые можно получать через порт или специальные объекты.
•   Благословения дают бонусы, такие как еда и счастье.
•   Победа за очки славы и боевой опыт позволяет выбирать направления клана и улучшать защиту.
•   Игра глубокая и многогранная.
•   Это отличная RTS с уникальными кланами, способная подарить интересные матчи с друзьями.
Недостатки игры:
•   Отсутствие матчмейкинг системы - большой минус.
•   Медленный старт игры требует времени на подготовку, что может быть как плюсом, так и минусом.
•   Иногда карты могут быть неудачными, но это редкость.
•   Покупка DLC не имеет смысла, так как кланы должны быть доступны бесплатно при покупке игры.

Nach einigen Stunden kann ich sagen, dass in dem Spiel für jeden was dabei ist: Es gibt einen Multiplayer, eine Singleplayer-Kampagnen und für JEDES Volk eine Extra Kampagne. 
Vergleichbar ist das Spiel schwer mit anderen RTS, entweder man mag das Spiel oder nicht.
Es läuft auf vielen Toster-PCs und Grafik finde ich nicht schlecht.

Jeder Klan, den man (nicht im Sale) für 4,49€ kauft, kann man im Single- und Multiplayer spielen und jeder Klan hat eine zusätzliche eigene Kampagne mit 9 Missionen, die auch nochmal 8-10h beschäftigt (bei einem normalen Schwierigkeitsgrad).
Mit Cross of Vidar ist nochmal eine ganze Kampagne und ein weiteres Volk enthalten
Preis für alles somit sehr fair.

Und wegen Balancing: Die einen schreiben, Clan X ist zu stark, die anderen schreiben Clan X ist zu schwach. Eine echte Tier-Liste gibt es nicht (da haben auch die Experten unterschiedliche Sichten) und somit würde ich schon eher sagen, die Clans sind sehr ausgeglichen. 



PS: Auf Gog und Steam gekauft, hauptsächlich auf GoG gespielt, deswegen hier nur 25h.

Northgard è un gioiello per gli amanti dei giochi di strategia. Un mix perfetto tra gestione risorse, costruzione e conquista, ambientato in un'atmosfera vichinga davvero affascinante. Ecco cosa mi ha colpito di più:

    Gameplay Profondo: Ogni clan ha il suo stile di gioco unico, che cambia radicalmente l’approccio alle partite. Puoi concentrarti sull’economia, sulla guerra o sulla cultura, offrendo infinite strategie.
    Gestione delle Risorse: Cruciale e stimolante. Pianificare come gestire cibo, legna e denaro, soprattutto durante i rigidi inverni, aggiunge un livello di sfida che adoro.
    Multiplayer Coinvolgente: Giocare con gli amici è un’esperienza divertente e competitiva. Collaborare o sfidarsi offre sempre nuovi motivi per tornare al gioco.
    Supporto Costante: Gli sviluppatori rilasciano aggiornamenti regolari, aggiungendo nuovi clan e modalità. Durante i saldi, i DLC diventano molto accessibili.
    Atmosfera Unica: Grafica semplice ma affascinante, colonna sonora epica e un’ambientazione che ti immerge nel mondo norreno.

Lo consiglio vivamente a chi ama gli strategici, da giocare in solitaria o con gli amici. Ogni partita è diversa e offre sfide sempre nuove. Se vi affascina il tema vichingo e cercate un gioco che richieda pianificazione ma non sia troppo stressante, Northgard è la scelta perfetta.

Voto finale: 9/10

185302689.review:
Northgard - это лично для меня спокойная, затягивающая стратегия, которая точно подойдет тем, кто любит игры с акцентом на планирование и выживание. Здесь ты руководишь кланом викингов, пытаясь выжить в суровых условиях: собираешь ресурсы, защищаешь территорию от врагов и готовишься к холодным зимам, случайные события с атаками на твои земли, ветки прокачивания хоть и примитивные. 

Мне, как ценителю славянской, скандинавской мифологии понравилась атмосфера, скандинавские мотивы переданы круто, и музыка отлично дополняет картинку. У каждого клана есть свои фишки, из-за чего игра не становится однообразной. Например, один клан хорошо исследует новые территории, другой больше подходит для боев, а третий фокусируется на торговле.

Игра держит в напряжении, особенно зимой, когда еды и дров всегда не хватает, и ты буквально на грани выживания. Но к концу партии иногда начинаешь уставать от рутинных действий, когда главная цель уже почти достигнута.

Для одиночной игры ИИ местами слишком предсказуем, зато в мультиплеере всё зависит только от твоей стратегии. Если любишь соревноваться с друзьями — Northgard зайдет отлично, а так же если любишь быть изнасилованным в рейтинговой, быстрой игре от любителей после завода оформить пива которые уничтожать тебя за 3 года - милости просим. 

Это не та стратегия, где нужно всё делать быстро, да, ты за пару лет можешь захватить какую-то вражескую деревню, но где весь сок от эмоций если партия длилась минут 20-30? Northgard лично для меня больше про терпение, медитативность, продуманное управление и красивые виды. Если нравится такой подход, точно рекомендую!

Лично мне игра понравилась, но играть в неё много подряд не стал бы, она скорее для того, чтобы расслабиться вечером за парой партий.

185244322.review:
北境之地：谁教你这么做游戏的？
尚且不论游戏大量的付费种族dlc，还有几乎没有人玩的服务器，我花了12小时打通了原版战役，打完的评价为：烂。
第一问题：新手引导缺失。有许多机制根本没有介绍在教程里，而是藏在了建筑说明等地方。例如，原版战役的最终关，我无法让部队进入左上方的野猪族领土，游戏只是简简单单表现一个红叉，去查了才知道侦察兵必须要升级才能进入敌方领土。你好歹给个提示，一个点不动的红叉算什么意思，搞的这一关我快把全图都打穿完了，洛基想招巨人的时候发现所有的门都被我拆了。
第二问题：游戏系统难评。我知道建筑数量限制、人口限制、兵力限制是北境之地特色，但是玩了这么久我还是想说这套系统只会让人玩的头疼而一点都没有rts该有的感觉。别家rts是指挥各种各样的兵种打架，咱们北境之地更像是和后勤系统摔跤，而且还是非常持久且无聊的，让人越玩越不好评价。
第三问题：汉化。打赢以后跳出来的是大大的红色描边“？？”，我知道那是“胜利”，但是还是很难绷。打完以后制作组的也是“？？？？”，哎。另外部分汉化文本也有问题，比如说食物线第二大列第二个筒仓的升级，什么什么“每个升级后的筒仓增加3的食物和5”，让人困惑。
第四问题：游戏整体手感烂。之前买北境之地就是看视频的时候感觉画面挺精致并且玩法还挺有趣，实际上手哎那叫一个一言难尽啊。我是真不知道这一部分怎么形容。
总评，如果和好友欢乐联机这游戏勉强有存在的价值，除此以外的情况均评价为严重不合格，属于是华而不实、金玉其外败絮其中的游戏。虽然维京rts三兄弟北境之地、祖先遗产、维京之城都有玩起来不如意的地方，但我感觉还是北境之地在难评方面最为重量级。

Do you find yourself questioning whether you need this?
You've landed in the right review, my dear reader, for I have a tale to tell.

I, a visionary (and perhaps mildly unhinged) emperor, began my rule with lofty ideals. I nurtured my empire—briefly. Built a farm here, a workshop there. But then it hit me: why toil in mediocrity when you can ascend to greatness through pure, unrelenting efficiency?

And so, I made my move. I abandoned production entirely. Farms? Closed. Lumberyards? Boarded up. My people? Every last one of them was thrust into the glorious grind of trade. More citizens arrived, hopeful and hungry? Straight to the trade routes!
No one dined lavishly under my rule, but no one got special treatment either. Equality, comrades!

Starvation? Merely a temporary hiccup in the grand design.
You see, I had a dream: an empire defined not by fields or forests, but by a triumphant trade victory.
Food was a distraction. Resources? A crutch. My people? Let’s just call them… investments.

And so, the empire fell apart, piece by starving piece. The fields turned barren, the cities became hollow shells of their former selves. Yet my caravans? Oh, they thrived! Wealth poured in. The markets sang of my genius.

Victory was mine, dear reader! Sure, it was a lonely victory, with only a handful of skeletal peasants left to cheer. But that’s the price of progress! A true leader knows sacrifices must be made for the greater good (read: my good).

And so, I invite you to join me. Dive into this magnificent game of ambition, cunning, and the occasional minor inconvenience of mass starvation.
You won’t regret it… unless you value morality. Or empathy. Or, you know, basic human decency.
But if you crave glory, trade supremacy, and the thrill of seeing your empire crumble beautifully around you?
Be like me. Embrace the chaos. Conquer the markets. And may your peasants—what’s left of them—sing songs of your ruthlessness.

185198903.review:
Northgard is a fun game with a lot of potential, but it often feels like it's stuck in a perpetual beta state.
New bugs are frequently introduced with updates, and frustratingly, some older bugs tend to reappear as well.
This pattern seems to coincide with the release of new DLCs, which focus more on adding content to drive sales rather than ensuring the base game is fully polished.

The campaign is a highlight of the game — it's engaging and, by now, should be relatively stable after addressing many earlier issues.
However, the Conquest mode is still plagued by numerous bugs, which can hinder the overall experience.

The AI in the game is particularly frustrating. Instead of being "intelligent," they rely heavily on blatant cheating. There are significant discrepancies between AI clans: some will obliterate you with massive armies despite having virtually no visible economy, clearly benefiting from resource generation cheats. Others are so poorly designed that they practically self-destruct in some Conquest missions, making their behavior wildly inconsistent and often immersion-breaking.

As for multiplayer, I can't comment since I don't play it, but it's worth researching if that's a primary interest for you.

[b]In summary[/b], Northgard is a game I'd cautiously recommend.
While it offers an enjoyable and unique experience, its persistent technical problems and uneven updates make it hard to fully endorse. Still fun to play, but can be frustrating sometimes.
If you're willing to look past the flaws, it can be worth your time — but proceed with tempered expectations.

[h1] Nortgard - A Relaxing and Strategic Viking Adventure [/h1]

[b] Rating: ★★★★☆ (4/5) [/b]

Nortgard is a beautifully crafted strategy game that blends the thrill of managing a Viking clan with the calm of a slower paced experience. As you build and expand your settlement in a harsh Norse landscape, you’ll have to balance resource management, exploration, and diplomacy, all while defending your clan from mythological creatures and rival factions.

What stands out is the game’s relaxing pace. Unlike other frantic RTS titles, Nortgard lets you enjoy a methodical, more thoughtful approach to gameplay. This makes it perfect for those looking to unwind after a long day while still engaging in strategic decision making.

The graphics are crisp and charming, with a beautifully animated world full of seasonal changes and detailed environments. The strategic depth of the game, from managing your resources to engaging in combat, is rewarding. That said, the game’s slow pace might not be for everyone, but if you’re in the mood to relax and enjoy a tactical challenge, Nortgard is a solid choice.

In conclusion, if you’re a fan of strategy games and want a laid back Viking adventure, Nortgard will definitely satisfy. A great game for anyone who wants to feel like a true Norse leader, just don’t expect a fast-paced, action packed experience. Highly recommended for relaxing gaming sessions!

Ever wanted to summon a giant wolf or explore new territories like a true Viking? Nortgard lets you do just that!

Thumbs up if you agree! ⚔️🛡️🔥

184843033.review:
Northgard could have been a really nice RTS / management game - but has been ruined primarily by it's totally dreadful visual design and complete lack of visual clarity. 
I just can't easily and clearly distinguish what is going on against the background most of the time, and certainly not with any speed. Something essential in an RTS. 
I've even tried colorblind modes and nothing helped. 
And then the fog arrives and makes it so much worse to such an extent that I just gave up trying to playing during fog. 
Is this the intention? 
Make a game unplayable? 
That's not enjoyable on any level. 
These are the results of some really poor choices by the design team.

The game theoretically ticked so many of my + boxes too. 
Maybe it was satotaged by the visual design team.

Add to the problems list: the in game menus, unit selection and the UI. 
All need a significant application of: ease of use, positioning and visual clarity. 

Those sections of the map that are visible but not in your control are difficult to distinguish and poorly marked; hover tool-tips - their positioning and what information they provide - none of it is well thought out.
On paper this game looks like it would be awesome. Really awesome. Franchise awesome.
 
Was there a battle between the developers themselves? Whoever made those calls made the wrong calls.  
AOE 1 - 4 doesn't suffer any of these problems. Neither did the vast majority of other RTSs. 
So what happened with the visuals when Northgard was being made? 
If you want to make the game play challenging, make the tasks in the game difficult. 
Don't make game visually obscure.
 
And don't get me started on the 'daft as a brush' idea that if you pause the game you can't move the camera or access anything at all other than the settings menus. If multiplayer pausing is a concern then just disable that feature in multiplayer. Problem sorted. Move on to more fundamental things. Certainly don't defend the position if you're the developer.

Northgard could have been a really great game but so many good ideas have been implemented so poorly. 
4 / 10. 
Some great ideas in there - if only I could play them and not have to struggle with the terrible visuals. 
Playing it is a frustrating experience and all that is left is a case of a missed opportunity as to what could have been a great game - but is a mess.

Do you ponder why you should get this?
You're at the right review, I have a story for you;


I, a benevolent (and perhaps slightly sociopathic) monarch, nurtured my clan... briefly. Just enough to build a couple more things, before realising, efficiency is the key to victory!

So, I withdrew peasants from producing anything. Yes, quite literally anything and I straight up put everyone to trade labour.
More mouths to feed arrived? Same treatment.
Equality, my friends!
No one gets neither a free lunch nor a special treatment when I reign!

Starvation? Not a setback but a minor inconvenience.
You see, I had a vision: a glorious trade victory! A victory, I say, my friends!
The people? Expendable. Wood? A luxury. Food? For the weak!
My goal was clear: conquer the markets, not the dinner tables!

And thus, my glorious reign continued.
The kingdom withered, the people crumbled, but the trade routes flourished.
A true leader knows the sacrifice is but a price for progress.

And in the end we were victors!
Well… at least me and the left over couple peasants who were about to fall for the starvation.
But we nonetheless won, my friends. I always lead my clan to victory!


Now, go treat yourself this magnificent game of ambition, efficiency, and the occasional mass starvation.
You won't regret it... unless you value human life.
Otherwise… Be like me, go forth and conquer! Give yourself to the ruthless efficiency! Embrace the mass starvation!

184712721.review:
Northgard is a brilliant blend of real-time strategy and Norse mythology, delivering a deeply satisfying experience that feels fresh and innovative within the genre. Set in a beautifully realized world inspired by Viking lore, the game challenges you to lead your clan to victory by managing resources, exploring uncharted territories, and overcoming harsh winters and rival factions.

The gameplay strikes a perfect balance between accessibility and depth. It’s easy to pick up for newcomers, but its layered mechanics offer plenty of strategic complexity for seasoned players. Every decision matters—whether it’s expanding your territory, balancing your economy, or preparing for the unforgiving winters. The way the game weaves environmental challenges, diplomacy, and combat into its gameplay creates a dynamic experience where no two matches feel the same.

The visual design is charming and clean, with a stylized aesthetic that perfectly captures the harsh beauty of the North. The sound design, from the crunch of snow underfoot to the distant howls of wolves, enhances the immersive atmosphere.

What truly sets Northgard apart is its ability to evoke a sense of exploration and survival. Discovering new lands, unearthing ancient relics, and facing mythical creatures make every game feel like a Viking saga come to life.

Whether you’re playing through the story-driven campaign, competing against friends, or testing your wits against AI, Northgard delivers a unique and rewarding RTS experience. It’s a must-play for fans of strategy games and Norse mythology alike.

184675422.review:
Northgard is a captivating real-time strategy game inspired by Norse mythology. Players control a clan of Vikings to explore, expand, and survive in an unforgiving environment filled with mythical creatures, hostile clans, and harsh winters.

[b]Pros[/b]

[list]
[*] Unique Setting and Atmosphere: The Norse mythology theme, combined with a beautifully crafted map and soundtrack, creates an immersive experience.

[*] Engaging Gameplay: A mix of city-building, resource management, and strategy ensures depth and replayability.

[*]Diverse Clans: Each clan has unique abilities and playstyles, allowing for varied approaches to victory.

[*]Multiple Victory Conditions: Offers flexibility in gameplay with conditions like domination, trade, lore, and fame.

[*]Challenging AI and Multiplayer: AI opponents provide a solid challenge, and multiplayer matches add a competitive edge.

[*]Easy to Learn, Difficult to Master: Intuitive mechanics make it accessible for newcomers, while strategic depth keeps veterans engaged.
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]

[list]
[*] Pacing: The slow start can feel tedious for players used to faster RTS games.

[*] Limited Combat Mechanics: Battles lack complexity compared to other RTS games, focusing more on positioning and numbers than tactics.

[*] Repetitive Mid-Game: Resource management and expansion can feel repetitive after multiple playthroughs.

[*] Occasional Balancing Issues: Some clans or strategies can feel overpowered, especially in multiplayer.

[*] UI Clutter: Managing multiple regions can sometimes feel overwhelming due to limited interface options.
[/list]


[b]TLDR[/b]

Northgard is a refreshing take on the RTS genre, blending Norse mythology with deep strategic elements. While it has some shortcomings in pacing and combat complexity, its engaging mechanics and unique setting make it a must-try for fans of strategy and city-building games. 

[h3]I'd probably recommend catching the game on sale and avoid paying full price.[/h3]

184517458.review:
8/10 Great RTS Game                                                                                                                                                             Wow, I wished I had picked up Northgard sooner. This is very much a modernized version of Age of Empires with some boardgame-like elements. Normally, I hate elements that are boardgame-like, but it works really well here. Also, I gotta say that you wouldn't even know this was Early Access with how polished and full of content it is (I did have one crash, though). I booted it up and four hours flew by. Took me about an hour to get my head around the mechanics.

Essentially, this is a RTS game with a variety of victory conditions. Everything is fully customizable. I only played single player and that mode is great; I'm excited to try multiplayer. Because it has multiplayer, there is no manipulation of time or pausing. Some refer to this title as a 'city builder', but I don't see really any aspects of city building - it's a RTS like Age of Empires. What really makes Northgard stand out from the pack is how the map is built from large tiles. The tiles create a whole new dimension to how you go about playing the game. Here are some interesting things:
You can only build on your tiles, and each tile has a colonization cost (usually food).
Not all tiles are created equal; many have powerful resources and/or buffs associated with them.
There is a special victory condition associated with a tile on each map; there are variations of this tile that are quite unique. For example, one I had to colonize was covered in magma. Once I got there, I needed to build a forge and then craft a special sword. Once I crafted it, I won. It was neat.
Everything felt great, overall. I'll definitely be dumping time into this one. I like the achievements, too.

Pros:
+Very polished and full of content already
+While staying true to the RTS genre, it definitely brings tons of fresh new ideas and mechanics to the table; the tiles are an outstanding addition
+UI is super clean and easy to understand
+Music and artwork are great
+The currently available factions all have cool attributes and lend themselves well to varying strategy

Cons:
-Honestly, I haven't found anything to really nit-pick about yet

[h1]❄️ Northgard : Quand les Vikings se mettent au Sim City... et mangent des racines ❄️[/h1]  
[p]Temps de jeu : 25 heures (ou 100 si vous aimez voir vos petits Vikings se transformer en pros du tricot entre deux batailles).[/p]  
[p]Genre : Stratégie en temps réel avec une dose de gestion nordique (et un soupçon de sueur pendant les hivers).[/p]  
[hr]  
[p]Dans Northgard, vous incarnez un chef de clan Viking chargé de conquérir une terre gelée peuplée de loups, de draugar, et probablement d’un troll qui n'a pas pris de douche depuis la dernière glaciation. Entre couper du bois, lancer des raids, et éviter que vos villageois meurent de faim (ou se révoltent parce que vous avez oublié de construire une taverne), vous ne manquerez pas d’action.[/p]  
[h2]Les points positifs :[/h2]  
[p]🛡️ Gameplay : Une masterclass de gestion stratégique. Préparez vos plans… ou laissez vos Vikings improviser avec leurs haches. Spoiler : ce n'est pas toujours une bonne idée.[/p]  
[p]🌍 Univers : Des paysages magnifiques, mais attention où vous marchez, les draugar ont tendance à surgir quand on admire trop le coucher de soleil.[/p]  
[p]👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Clans variés : Du clan du Loup, parfait pour les bastonneurs, au clan de l’Écureuil, idéal pour les fans de provisions (et de noisettes, probablement).[/p]  
[p]🤝 Multijoueur : Travailler ensemble ou trahir vos amis n’a jamais été aussi satisfaisant. Rien ne dit « je t’apprécie » comme un raid surprise sur leur village.[/p]  
[p]📖 Campagne solo : Une histoire qui mélange mythologie nordique et le plaisir de voir vos villageois crier « Aux armes ! » à la moindre ombre suspecte.[/p]  
[h2]Les points négatifs :[/h2]  
[p]⏳ Temps de jeu : Les parties peuvent durer longtemps, surtout si votre stratégie consiste à rester caché dans un coin jusqu'à ce que tout le monde meure de faim. Bold move, mais pas toujours efficace.[/p]  
[p]🗺️ Gestion de l’espace : Vous rêvez d’une métropole Viking ? Oubliez. Vos zones sont limitées, et il faudra choisir entre une ferme ou un camp d’entraînement. Pas les deux, désolé.[/p]  
[p]🤖 IA : Parfois brillante, parfois aussi inspirée qu’un Viking qui tente de nager dans l’Arctique. Bonne chance, chef.[/p]  
[hr]  
[p]En résumé, Northgard, c’est le jeu qui vous fait dire : « Une partie rapide ? »... puis vous réalise que c’est déjà 3 heures du matin. Entre les raids épiques, les hivers dévastateurs, et les décisions stratégiques (taverne ou caserne ? Spoiler : toujours taverne), vous allez passer un excellent moment. Juste, n’oubliez pas de nourrir vos villageois. Ou pas, si vous voulez voir jusqu’où ils peuvent marcher avant de tomber. [/p]

Играл от безысходности.
Из плюсов - симпатичная графика.
Из минусов - душный геймплей,  крайне долгие катки.
Если компания ещё более менее, сюжет хоть немного подогревал интерес, то в режиме завоевания полная беда. Скучно, однообразно, доооолго и много зависит от рандома.
Например в какой-то момент если ботов переклинит, то они все разом нападают на тебя, даже не по очереди, а сразу. Притом гений который писал АИ прописал такое пакостное поведение ботов, что даже игроки в доте так мерзко себя не ведут.
Например бот может просто наступать, на линию вашего региона, ждать когда вы побегите отбивать её, но как только вы приближаетесь, он просто перебегает на вашу соседнюю область и поступает так же, из-за того что в игре тол и баг,  то ли фича мои разведчики не могли разведать вражескую территорию урода и просто открытой местности процент зависал из за чего мои викинги просто смотрели на врага на его территории и ничего не могли сделать.
Добил меня всё тот же режим завоевания, где я пытался убить  всех ботов играя за волка, там опять не открылись территории противника я  почти 6 часов потратил впустую.
Всем кто говорит, что эта игра глоток свежего воздуха, рекомендую поиграть в Realm Batels начала 2000х, игра явно вдохновлялась подобным, только кастрировала боёвку, залила всё тонной менеджмента с блёсками современной технологии генерации контента.
Играл оффлайн, больше никогда не запущу.

Положительный отзыв, только потому, что игра в разработке и возможно экономическая стратегия не мой жанр. Брать только по скидке. Удачи разработчикам.

184337888.review:
Resenha: Northgard

Northgard, é um jogo de estratégia em tempo real que combina temas de sobrevivência e mitologia nórdica, entregando uma experiência divertita e envolvente.

Ambientação e Estilo Visual

A ambientação de Northgard é um dos seus maiores trunfos. O mundo é desenhado em um estilo artístico vibrante e detalhado, com paisagens que variam de florestas densas e montanhas geladas a fiordes costeiros e ruínas ancestrais. Essa estética, combinada com a trilha sonora atmosférica, captura a essência da mitologia nórdica, tornando o jogo imersivo e memorável.

Jogabilidade e Mecânicas

Northgard se diferencia de outros jogos de estratégia pela sua ênfase no gerenciamento de recursos e sobrevivência. O clima hostil – incluindo invernos rigorosos que exigem planejamento meticuloso (É sério) – adiciona uma camada de desafio que obriga o jogador a priorizar eficiência e adaptação.

Cada clã viking possui características únicas que impactam a jogabilidade. Por exemplo, o clã do Lobo é agressivo e focado em combate, enquanto o clã do Veado se destaca na economia. Isso cria uma variedade estratégica que mantém o jogo interessante mesmo após múltiplas partidas. Além disso, Northgard oferece diferentes condições de vitória, como:

Dominação Militar: Subjugando os oponentes pela força.
Desenvolvimento Econômico: Acumulando riquezas e recursos.
Conquista de Relíquias: Explorando o mapa e descobrindo mistérios nórdicos.

Campanha e Multijogador

A campanha de Northgard apresenta uma narrativa simples, que serve como introdução às mecânicas e ao mundo do jogo. Já o modo multijogador, não sei oque dizer, pois não joguei.

Pontos Positivos

1. Ambientação: O design artístico e a atmosfera nórdica são impecáveis.
2. Estratégia Profunda: As diferentes condições de vitória e clãs únicos criam uma jogabilidade variada e desafiante.
3. Clima como Mecânica: Os invernos e eventos aleatórios adicionam realismo e tensão.

Pontos Negativos

1. Curva de Aprendizado Íngreme: Jogadores iniciantes podem achar as mecânicas complexas no começo.
2. IA Limitada: Em algumas situações, a inteligência artificial pode ser previsível e menos desafiadora.
3. Repetitividade: Após muitas horas, algumas partidas podem começar a parecer similares.

Conclusão

Nota Final: 8.5/10
Um jogo indispensável para quem aprecia estratégia com um toque de mitologia nórdica e pra quem fã de RTS.

It is not an outright bad game. It is just not good, barely even mediocre.

To be clear I have only played the story mode in the 15 hours I played, and I didn’t bother to finish all the way through. I bought it super cheap on sale but am most disappointed that I spent a whole 15 hours on it.


The game in general:
- Battle mechanics are unsatisfying; you chose between three different unit types besides your hero (warrior, axe thrower, shield bearer). No one, not even the hero has any special abilities or other things to spice up things in the battle department. 

- There are different lords with different playstyles that are neat and help make things varied, even though it isn’t as shallow as everything else it could be developed more.

- Upgrades for both buildings and units are shallow and there is only one level of upgrades for everything. A boost in production and an additional slot for workers for buildings and

- Visuals are fine but doesn’t excel or stand out

- Story is boring and generic and the cutscenens in the beginning of missions are soooo slow to get through when there is no skip option.


I bought it super cheap on sale, but I am most disappointed that I spent a whole 15 hours on it in the hope that more game mechanics and units would be unearthed further into the game.

In the end it is way outclassed by decades old RTS’s. I would recommend anyone looking for games in the genre to instead look for AoE 2, Dawn of war, or Company of heroes when they are on sale if you haven’t already. They have much more depth and variety that lasts you hundreds of hours.

183994067.review:
Northgard is a super interesting 4X RTS: as in it's almost like a Settlers of Catan except played in real-time. Relatively slow paced, lower complexity than Age of Empires 4, with way lower micro required. Instead, the focus is more on strategy with multiple victory options (Fame/Trade/Wisdom/Conquest/Map-specific unique victory/Clan-unique victory) available.

Also besides the single player campaign and permutations of multiplayer, it has two dedicated game modes designed around cooperative play.. Conquest and Bifrost.. Both are dynamic cooperative campaigns meant to be played over multiple sessions with the former being based around winning various dynamically generated scenarios against other AI factions, and the latter being pure PvE (survive against the environments and elements and escape before you're overwhelmed).

I did find the base game Single Player campaign underwhelming though (in that it wasn't particularly enticing). Good though to just get your feet wet and gradually learn the basics of the game. Conquest is where things get really interesting.

Got this at 90% discount for myself and a 9-year old to play co-op with, and found it to be of tremendous amount of value for money. Individual DLC clans are also reasonably priced (esp. when on sale) given how differently they play compared to the base-game factions, which help shake things up and add to the appeal.

I can only imagine that this game was merely ok back when it first released, but in end 2024, it is in a fantastic state as you benefit from years of free additions and patches to the base-game over time.

183992742.review:
With the amount of clans available, each with their own unique perks, who knows which faction can you win you over? It's less about having the largest army and more of crucial decision-making and resource management. Do you pick a tile that has iron and stone for building/unit upgrades, wood to build structures and keep units warm during winter, lore for unlocking passive perks, or food to feed your clan? In a way its like a chess match where you must carefully plan out which zone to prioritize and colonize. Multiple victory option assures that winning isn't solely about annihilating the opposing factions.

My favorite clan is a tossup between the Raven and Boar clan.

A-

Над игрой проделано много работы, начиная от интересных механик, противных нпс в виде Йотунов и заканчивая огромным разнообразием кланов геймплей которых ощутимо различается. 183886104.review:
A streamlined, small scope strategy game, which for me is a negative. 

The main mechanic here is exploration and colonization of new territories. Territories can contain resources, and you'll have to figure out which ones will help you the most. One slightly arbitrary and not very immersive feature is the limit for buildings per territory despite visually there being plenty of space; you'll have three buildings with 80% of it being empty land and the game just won't let you build more, which I suppose is meant to incentivize constant acquisition of new ones. So the loop here is acquire a territory, decide the 2-3 buildings you're going to build in it, rinse and repeat. Sometimes you'll have to kill off the wolves or the monsters in the territory first, but these feel like skirmishes rather than battles.

183735420.review:
Yeah okay I'll recommend this. 

I'm not generally into Strategy games.  I get RSI pretty bad in my right hand when I use Mouse & Keyboard for extended periods. 

But this is a cute little Viking RTS with a couple Story Modes, ton of DLC options, and an absolute motherload of Achievements.   Turns out when I order my unplayed games by number of Achievements, most of the top 10 are strategy games, and this one had a few ultra rare cheevos...   PLUS all the Achievements can be gained in Single Player, so no need for MP Boosting.   Still, my RSI issues mean I'll be playing this for a LONG time before I can 100% it.

Note:  It IS kinda buggy.  Some achievements might be inaccessible or unlock at random times because the game has been changed since they were added.  I've not encountered any so far that I couldn't get at all though.  Some of them just too a little lateral thinking (and some only unlock when you open the chest in the expeditions section). 

So yeah.   I'd give it.... a 7/10.

183730341.review:
遊戲從早期的單機4X為主內容發展至今成為50%4X，50%RTS遊戲。
每年固定大更新一次以及2個可玩部族DLC，以及更多新加入的BUG。
目前PVE和PVP內容都相當優秀。
PVP主流是3VS3，再者是FFA。
PVE可以打AI，征服，彩虹橋三種模式。也相當有特色。
我個人只單玩PVE內容也能玩得很開心。

是一款系統易學但整體超難精通，甚至很長一段時間會覺得鬼打牆原地無法進步的遊戲。
種族很多，每一個部族乍看只有被動和幾個科技不同，但玩起來差異非常大。
如何利用各部族獨特的優勢拿下勝利是很重要的。
一局遊戲根據情況時間從35分-2小時不等。勝利方式有很多種。

PVE的征服模式很優秀。可以單人或兩人合作。
一趟征服會打三個根據房主的部族選的固定主節點和4-8個隨機抽選規則的副節點。
副節點的獎勵是抽取3選1，讓每一局遊戲有不同的變化性。

彩虹橋為今年2024大更新的新模式。可1-4人合作。部族的科技樹被拔除，剩下這個模式特殊的被動以及原有的部族被動。
所有人只能攜帶幾種建築進場，可幫盟友蓋自己有的建築。玩家要防守每年的怪物群攻擊並找到出口離開。
有點像那些殭屍生存遊戲的RTS版啦!
每年存活和地圖支線會給獎勵，每個人抽取3選1，內容有獨特的建築，攻擊狀態，和那些被拔掉的科技與開場沒選的建築。
有意思的模式但獎勵和事件以及地圖都太少了，沒有征服耐玩。

與市面上RTS遊戲不同之處在於這款很重視經濟資源的平衡發展。
而與市面上4X遊戲不同的地方在於這款沒有過多的建設管理需要理解。
但又保留了4X遊戲裡的建築位置和資源循環概念。非常好的將兩種遊戲類型融合在一起。
要說這種做法缺點的話就是兩邊都不精吧!兵種沒有純RTS遊戲豐富，內政和外交方面沒有4遊戲豐富。

建議新手玩家看影片學習起手和理解影片的玩家在什麼時間點為什麼要做什麼，蓋什麼。
練習一陣子之後就能上手。
但PVE和PVP遊戲步調以及中立怪物強度不同的關係，玩法會改變。可別鈔作業了。

在特價時極推薦入手的遊戲。銅板價的超優秀作品。
先玩主程式，再慢慢買想玩的部族就可以了。

183680841.review:
For me, conquest mode is the bread and butter of this game. 

Campaign is chill but nothing special.

I haven't bothered with pvp.

I haven't touched the relatively new bifrost gamemode.

Now for the conquest mode: Each clan has 3 static scenarios with static rewards unique for that clan specifically and 8 random scenarios with random rewards. There are some variation in the reward pool for each clan, but mostly it's just +2 to that +3 to this. These rewards are persistent for the rest of the "run" and every conquest playthrough is slightly different. Sometimes you get upgrades that encourage to experiment with your build orders. Sometimes you get just the right bonuses for the clan you're playing and the snowball is beautiful. The map for every scenario is random generated even on static scenarios. If you don't like your maps rerolled everytime you fail, save your game at the beginning of the scenario. Once you complete all 11 scenarios you can't continue that savefile. Bit of a bummer really as I would love to have the option to play completed scenarios again with all the unlocked powers. Although still pretty simple, I have yet to find RTS with more appealing PvE replayability for me. Because conquest mode is purely PvE, I don't find clan balance to be an issue. Every clan will end up completely broken strong in the end. Oh did I mention it's also co-op?

183673721.review:
Northgard впечатляет большим разнообразием кланов, за которые можно играть, а также тем, что эта игра заставляет думать. Плюсом является постоянная поддержка разработчиков, которые регулярно обновляют игру. Однако есть и некоторые недостатки, среди которых выделяются проблемы с балансом некоторых кланов и сервера. Бывают моменты, когда играть в рейтинге просто невыносимо из-за задержек, но добавление серверов в России несколько улучшило ситуацию.

Игровая механика требует глубокого понимания, чтобы начать разрабатывать свои тактики и билды. Несмотря на 100 часов игры, я всё ещё не могу придумывать сложные стратегии, но клан Горностая мне понравился — именно с ним я добрался до золотого уровня в дуэлях. Сюжет игры не вызывает большого интереса, однако ИИ идеально подходит для отработки начальных билдов перед переходом в рейтинговые игры.

Прогрессия чувствуется в PvP: побеждать противников в рейтинге после долгих тренировок с ботами доставляет огромное удовольствие. Это одна из тех игр, где каждый успех ощущается как награда за проделанную работу. В целом, я бы поставил игре 8 из 10, снимая баллы за проблемы с серверами и баланс кланов.

183636057.review:
Northgard is an exceptional game that offers a rich and engaging experience for a variety of playstyles. It’s highly addictive, drawing players in with its strategic depth and replayability. Whether you prefer playing solo, co-op, or against others, the game provides a solid and flexible experience. 

What sets Northgard apart is its diversity of gameplay options. While it may appeal to fans of Civilization due to its strategic nature, it is not a "light version" of that game. Instead, it brings its own unique blend of mechanics and gameplay that is both rewarding and immersive. The variety of clans adds another layer of depth, and the game does an excellent job of providing enough content through its base clans that additional clan purchases are not necessary—though experimenting with them is certainly enticing.

Moreover, the game is far from being abandoned; it is actively developed, with updates and new content keeping the experience fresh and evolving. If you're into strategy games and enjoy exploring different playstyles, Northgard will definitely keep you hooked for hours.

183617912.review:
[h1] Review of Key Aspects of Online Gameplay [/h1]

[h3] Game Issues: [/h3]
First, the servers are a big problem. It’s normal for a room to have to be recreated because someone couldn’t connect. During sales, it’s almost impossible to load into the game at all. This summer, servers and the Hound balance were a nightmare, but now things seem okay. Bugs are still common—sometimes I can’t build houses after the countdown, or the interface disappears. Reconnecting doesn’t always work the first time, and sometimes it doesn’t work at all. Bugs get fixed slowly, but the servers never improve.

[h3] Online Population: [/h3]
There are about 300 active players, not all at once, but during prime time, rooms fill up quickly with both new and experienced players. Everyone can find opponents. At night or in the morning, though, it’s bad—10–15 minutes of waiting. Ranked is worse, especially if you have high Elo. Below 400 points, matchmaking is okay, but higher up, it’s harder. Overall, 300 players are somehow enough for the game.

[h3] Balance: [/h3]
The balance doesn’t change often, mostly when new clans are added. Older clans rarely get updates, and full reworks are rare. Reworks mostly focus on lore, but their unique mechanics and buildings stay the same. In general, the game feels balanced, especially in 3x3 mode, so it doesn’t need constant fixes.

[h3] Game Modes: [/h3]
There are enough modes: solo, duo (up to 8 players), duels, 2x2, 3x3, and 4x4. Different maps with unique mobs make the game more interesting.

[h3] Meta: [/h3]
Some clans (aggressive ones) play well in year 801, while others (scaling clans) aim for 802. Aggressive clans are usually better, but in public games, it doesn’t matter much. Duels have dominant clans, and the meta rarely changes. Clans focused on 801 usually beat 802. In FFA, it’s random—you either get rushed or rush others, but it’s all luck. In 3x3, the meta is most balanced, with lots of synergies, and even without them, all clans are playable.

[h3] Repetitiveness: [/h3]
The game has many mechanics and clans, each with unique gameplay. Learning a clan takes dozens of games, and mastering it can take hundreds. Different clans, map layouts, matchups, and player skill levels keep the game fresh, even after many hours. PvE also has enough content to explore.

[h1] Conclusion: [/h1]
I love Northgard, but I can’t fully recommend it. The game isn’t getting worse, and new clans with cool mechanics are added (like Hounds with leveling units or Turtles with moving buildings). But the low player base and constant server issues will bother some people. On the bright side, DLCs and the game itself are affordable, especially during sales. Learning the game is fun and takes time, and the developers seem to be improving it, though not very actively. Overall, it’s a good strategy game, but only if you’re okay with its flaws.

183578864.review:
I have about 800 hours in this game, it's my weekend co-op with my wife. We're fairly casual gamers that enjoy a slow paced game. We've both been pretty unhappy with the roadmap of the game over the last year or so. A lot of what makes the clans fun has been removed or nerfed. Every time a clan DLC is released the game is just riddled with glitches in multiplayer. 

In this most recent patch, I've noticed the following: towers are basically worthless, raven raiding ships now move at light speed giving you almost no time to react, my most recent game I was at negative (or close to) food for the first half of the game despite half of my squares being food squares while playing the newest clan, which ground expansion to a halt. I've hardly ever had issues with food production in the game in the past. Playing against Raven was intense, they were blitzing me every few months and the AI was set on easy mode. Strangely when I finally managed to muster the army to fend them off, they just quit attacking me. 

Over the years there also were a lot of fun mechanics that took a huge hit, like Kraken. I would've much preferred that the devs lift up the other weaker clans instead of nerfing the few fun ones. Only a few clans have scaling in late game play. I was excited for the newest clan because they were advertised as a clan that was ideal for a player like me, but they just wind up taking a beating when facing other clans.

If I had to guess, I'd say the devs are balancing the game for really small maps of extremely skilled players that play Domination only. That's fine for the top 5-10% of players but really sucks out the fun for the casual players. I wish we could go back to a few years ago when the game was a lot more fun.
